Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and requirements for the IoT solution, including device types, data collection needs, and integration points.
Choose an appropriate IoT Central application template based on the project requirements, such as retail, healthcare, or energy.
Provision a new IoT Central application in the Azure portal, specifying the application name, region, and pricing plan.
Define device templates to model the devices that will connect to the IoT Central application, including telemetry, properties, and commands.
Configure device connectivity settings, including IoT Hub integration, device provisioning, and connection strings.
Enable security features such as device authentication, data encryption, and role-based access control (RBAC) for the IoT Central application.
Set up integrations with external systems such as Azure Data Explorer, Power BI, or third-party applications for data analysis and visualization.
Set up monitoring and alerting for device health, telemetry thresholds, and application performance using IoT Central's built-in tools.

Tasks.Task: Test Device Connectivity and Data Flow
Tasks.Task Description: Perform end-to-end testing to ensure devices can connect to the IoT Central application and data flows correctly to the configured endpoints.
Create detailed documentation for the IoT Central application setup, device templates, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing devices, monitoring data, and troubleshooting issues in IoT Central.
Verify that the IoT Central application meets regulatory compliance requirements and set up auditing procedures for ongoing compliance checks.
Continuously monitor the connectivity status of IoT devices registered in Azure IoT Central. Investigate and resolve any connectivity issues promptly.
Verify the security settings for devices, including authentication methods and encryption protocols. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Validate the integrity of data received from IoT devices. Identify and address any anomalies or inconsistencies in the data.
Test failover mechanisms to ensure high availability and resilience of the IoT Central application in case of service disruptions.
Review and audit user access permissions to ensure only authorized personnel have access to IoT Central resources.
Analyze device performance metrics and implement optimizations to improve efficiency and reduce latency.
Regularly back up configuration data for IoT Central, including device templates, rules, and settings. Store backups securely for restoration purposes.
Analyze application metrics to ensure the IoT Central application is operating within expected parameters. Address any performance deviations.
Review and update security policies for IoT Central to adapt to evolving threats and ensure compliance with industry standards.
Keep IoT Central documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, device templates, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or IoT Central application outages.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the IoT Central setup adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding IoT Central performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
